intro: The Nikkei dropped 5.4 per cent to end at 16,251.54 after swinging wildly in positive and negative territory as the exit poll results from the US vote rolled in.

title: China stocks end lower on US election jitters
intro: The blue-chip CSI300 index fell 0.5 per cent, to 3,353.5, while the Shanghai Composite Index lost 0.6 pct to 3,128.37 points.

title: Donald Trump elected 45th US President: Top five takeaways for Indian stock market
intro: Polls in the US had suggested an edge for Clinton, but Trump pipped her in a close race. To gain a majority, a candidate needs to secure a minimum of 270 votes.

title: Sensex’s 1,689-point plunge not even among 5 biggest crashes in BSE history!
intro: History suggests on two consecutive days on September 21 and 22, 2008, Sensex had witnessed a fall of over 2,000 pts in response to the Lehman Brothers collapse.

title: 10 blue chips alone wiped out Rs 77,000 crore in Wednesday’s meltdown; hope you survived
intro: HDFC, the third biggest firm by market-cap, had taken a Rs 9,457 crore hit to Rs 2.10 lakh crore. ITC and Infosys tanked up to 4 per cent.

title: PNB wants performance to do the wage-hike talking
intro: At present, industry body, the Indian Banks' Association (IBA), on behalf of all public sector banks, negotiates wage hike with officers' associations and employee unions.

title: Banks to finalise HCC's Rs 5,000-crore debt recast
intro: Sources from the banking industry said the company has sought for bank guarantee to hasten the arbitration process to recover its dues from different government agencies.

title: Learn with ETMarkets: Should one buy perpetual bonds?
intro: Perpetual bonds are fixed income instruments with no maturity date. They are not redeemable, which means investors in these instruments are assured interest payments forever.

title: Expert view: Who takes the cake and who takes the hit in currency crackdown; what’s in it for you
intro: In an unprecedented development, the Indian government announced the cancellation of the current high-denomination notes from circulation.
